Package com.tiyb.tev.controller

Class TEVAdminToolsController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tiyb.tev.controller.TEVAdminToolsController
  • @RestController
@RequestMapping("/admintools")
public class TEVAdminToolsController
extends java.lang.Object

    A non-advertised REST controller with some administration tools for working with the database behind the scenes.

    If TEV were ever to become anything more than just a local application, proper security would be needed around these operations, but since that's not the case the security is lax. None of these APIs are ever intended to be used by the UI.

    Author:
    tiyb

      • preDestroy

        @PreDestroy
public void preDestroy()
        Used to compact the database upon shutdown. This causes shutdown to take longer, but it's not very noticeable for an application of this size.

      • cleanImagesOnHD

        @GetMapping("/posts/cleanImagesOnHD")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> cleanImagesOnHD()
        GET request to delete all of the duplicate images that end up on the hard drive, coming from the Tumblr export. For photo posts, when the images are actually in the export, Tumblr includes duplicates of every image, such that there are twice as many images stored on the HD as necessary. This helper API retrieves all Photo posts, checks how many images are supposed to be there, then looks at the HD to see the number of files there. If there are exactly twice as many images as there should be, the duplicates are deleted.
        Returns:
        String indicating the success or failure of the process

      • importImages

        @PostMapping("/posts/importImages")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> importImages​(@RequestBody
                                                                              java.lang.String imagePath)
        Copies all files from a source directory (posted as the body of the request) to the images directory stored in the metadata. Calls the cleanImagesOnHD() method when it's done, to clean the directory back up.
        Parameters:
        imagePath - The path of the source directory, from whence images should be retrieved.
        Returns:
        Success/failure message
